Class DatasetMatrix¶

class mbff.datasets.DatasetMatrix.DatasetMatrix(label)[source]¶

This class maintains a pair of matrices X and Y, along with their row labels and column labels. Its purpose is to pair together the two matrices of a real-world dataset, namely the feature variables (X) and objective variables (Y). Normally, a DatasetMatrix instance is generated by a dataset source when reading an external dataset.

The rows of X and Y at the same index represent a single sample in the dataset. This means that the matrices X and Y have the same number of rows.

Variables:
  • label – The label used to identify this instance of DatasetMatrix. It will be used when saving / loading the instance too.
  • X – A scipy.sparse matrix where the rows represent samples and the columns represent the feature variables. Can be either a scipy.sparse.csr_matrix instance or a scipy.sparse.csc_matrix instance.
  • Y – A scipy.sparse matrix where the rows represent samples and the columns represent the objective variables. Can be either a scipy.sparse.csr_matrix instance or a scipy.sparse.csc_matrix instance.
  • row_labels – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding sample in X and Y. Has exactly as many elements as X and Y have rows.
  • column_labels_X – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding feature variable in X. Has exactly as many elements as X has columns.
  • column_labels_Y – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding objective variable in Y. Has exactly as many elements as Y has columns.
  • final – A boolean flag which determines whether this DatasetMatrix instance is final or not. Initially False. Calling .finalize() will set this to True. Saving is possible only after finalizing. A loaded DatasetMatrix is always finalized.
finalize()[source]¶

Make final adjustments to the X and Y matrices. Calls .eliminate_zeros(), .check_format() and .tocsc() on both matrices, then set the self.final flag to True.

save(folder)[source]¶

Save X, Y, row labels and column labels as files in the subfolder [folder]/[self.label].

load(folder)[source]¶

Load X, Y, row labels and column labels from the files in the subfolder [folder]/[self.label].

diff(other)[source]¶

Generate a textual description of how this DatasetMatrix differs from the other.

delete_row(r)[source]¶

Delete the row at index r. This results in the deletion of row r from the X matrix and the Y matrix. Also deletes the corresponding label from row_labels.

delete_column_X(c)[source]¶

Delete the column at index c from the X matrix. Also deletes the corresponding label from column_labels_X.

delete_column_Y(c)[source]¶

Delete the column at index c from the X matrix. Also deletes the corresponding label from column_labels_Y.

delete_rows_cols(row_indices=[], col_indices=[])[source]¶

Remove the rows (denoted by row_indices) and columns (denoted by col_indices) from the CSR sparse matrix mat. WARNING: Indices of altered axes are reset in the returned matrix.

exception mbff.datasets.DatasetMatrix.DatasetMatrixNotFinalizedError(datasetmatrix, attempt)[source]¶
exception mbff.datasets.DatasetMatrix.DatasetMatrixFinalizedError(datasetmatrix, attempt)[source]¶
